comment: Sichel wants all students to do well. He tries to make things as interesting as possible despite the drab subject material. The only students who don't do well are the ones who don't come to class and expect the professor to do all the work and provide them with the grade. If you go to class and read the book this class shouldn't be bad at all.

This guy used to be an easy A bc his test were on computer and straight from quizlet. So people never went to class and everyone made a 100 on every test. He has changed his teaching methods since those glorious days to a straight up refusal to use computers or even think about them. He wont email or anything. still pretty easy though.
Never went to class, passed with a 95. Only three test and they're online!

This guy is super nice. I hardly went to class though, he really cares about his subject and will teach even if there are only 5 people who show up. The class is not a fun class at all, he tries to make it more interesting with real-world examples and discussions. You can find a lot of the answers on quizlet for the test. You use lockdown browser.
rating_tags: GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY--Would take again

comment: Easiest class I have taken at KSU. Grade is based off of 5 tests. I showed up to the very first class, and maybe one more during the semester, and thats all. Didnt purchase the textbook. 5 extra questions on each test for extra points, made over a 100 on every test. TAKE THIS CLASS
rating_tags: GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Would take again

comment: Sichel is awesome and a funny teacher. His class was an easy A as all of the homework, quizzes, and tests were through Connect. Attendance isn't mandatory at all but I did my best to go since I paid for this class. Lots of lectures that are boring because of the topic, but he tries to make it more amusing for the students. 10/10 would recommend!!

Really good professor. All assignments which include the readings and quizzes are on Connect and tests are online (5 of them with 55 Qs and 90mins) lectures sometimes dragged, but Dr. Sichel gave very good examples for some of the more obscure definitions. He'll also answer any questions you may have about the content.

I feel like the professor was too considered with his day job to be able to put in effort teaching. He cancelled at least 3 classes because he had to work, and then cancelled half of the assignments that were in the syllabus so your grade ended up being solely based on midterm and final. Plus lectures were extremely boring no one came to class.

I love professor Sichel! Second time I've taken him and even though the course work can be difficult to understand sometimes, he's always willing to help! He really doesn't like giving students below an A in his class - he just wants to see you try and attending class helps show him that... He's awesome!
Not an easy course but prof made very interesting and he is a good person, if you had problems outside of class, you can come and explain why you missed class he will understand and he is funny.

Entertaining, dry humor, and easily understandable. Tests can be difficult, but he usually adds a curve. Took a test almost every other week, but it allowed for a lot of grades. Lets you have 2 sheets of notes every test. Both going to class and reading the book are essential for an A. You need to apply the material, not just regurgitate it.

Professor Sichel was awesome! Very easy to follow in class. Read the book and write down what he lectures. Lets you use 2 page of notes on every test. I took him in the summer and being in there for almost 3 hours, he made it very interesting. Extra credit is given if you talk to him. Don't wait until the last minute. Would take him again!

very easy. Class is not mandatory, but you NEED TO BUY THE BOOK. You get a page of notes to use on every test also. I never went to class and just copied notes from the book when it was time to take tests. Make sure you take detailed notes and not just copy the vocab. gives ALOT of bonus points on each test. Wish i would have studied more
Best teacher I have had at KSU; extremely funny and informative. Made a boring subject enjoyable. Be sure to attend class as tests are directly from lectures.
Probably the best professor I have had at KSU.  Tests are directly from his lectures with multiple opportunities to make up if you miss one.  Funny guy, makes it very easy to pay attention.
Tests are easy and all the info for them is in the book! He also lets you use a page of notes for every test!
Great teacher, easy class. Attendance is not mandatory. There is no reason anyone should fail this class.

ABSOLUTELY LOVED HIM! wasn't too interested b4 taking the class & find it very interesting & love it! He tells you what will be on test & gives lots of examples to make material clear. If you pay attention & take notes you'll get at least a B! Reading the book is extra. I would take him again in a heart beat! can be sarcastic but he's approachable!

Attendance not manadatory, but go anyways. Let's you have notes on the tests, and tells you everything you need to put on there in class. Used the pretty often. Easy class, actually learned a couple things.
He's awesome and really easy. 8 tests. On each test, you can use 2 pages of notes. Make sure you actually make the note pages. That messed me up. He's great nonetheless.

Awesome prof! You can use notes on all tests. There are eight tests, but that just means each one covers less material.Attendance is not mandatory, but is extremely helpful. He tells you exactly what you need to know. I would take him again if I had the opportunity.

OUTSTANDING PROFESSOR. His lectures are clear cut on what you need to know. You are allowed notes on ALL test, mostly due to the fact that test  actually TEST you on knowledge of the material. Take this professor as soon as you can.

He is an excellent teacher. There are 8 tests, but he lets you use notes (1 page front and back). You can listen in class and not buy a book or not go to class and read the book. Either way you do it its an EASY A! (I chose the second one)
Great Teacher! You can either go to class and take notes (no book) and get a B or go to class and listen and read the book and guaranteed A. Very funny too.

He is an excellent teacher. There are 8 tests, but he lets you use notes (1 page front and back). Explains some difficult concepts with very good examples and analogies. He is pretty funny too, some nice dry humor. 40 questions on each test but he only grades out of 35, so you can get like a 115% on each test. Easy A

8 easy tests, use 2pgs notes on each, 4 on the final. just look on textbk and show up and take notes during class. I took this course as a freshmen and made an A. Great if you are taking a lot of classes and looking for something easy. TAKE HIM!!!!

This will be the most boring course you'll have to sit through, but it's worth it. I took it in the summer, and it was really boring, but he tells you when to write down something that is going to be on the test, and when you don't go, reading the book and taking notes to use on the test takes even longer.

I really hated his classes because they were so boring. I rarely showed up. His lectures are useless. All you have to do is read the book and you will do good. I really do NOT think he is a good teacher.

I would take him again if I had too he has 6 test and he gives 5 bonus points in questions and also curves it. Your allowed two pages of notes on each test, though at the end some people were using like 4. He is laid back and loves in class discussion so read before attending class if you go. Also buy a previous addition book and study it.

I barely went to class and managed to pull an A. 6 exams that are fairly easy if you write down the main points he says in class and read through the book. However, he is extremely boring and quick so you can never keep up. I suggest writing words and looking up definitions in the book. Concept problems can be tricky.

A friendly and approachable professor. The content is bland but that is not his fault. 2 pages of notes during the tests and 3 on the final. Tests are curved. Write down everything he writes down and says to write down and you will do fine. I would add the chapter definitions to your notes.  An easy A for sure.

He is sooo boring. And the class has very little to do with actual business. The ONLY good thing is that you get two pages of notes and the curves. He talks so fast and thinks everyone is a lawyer. He doesn't "dumb" down any definitions. If you take notes, master short hand cause he talks fast.
Take him! Several exams, but you get to use 2 pages of notes on the tests. The book covers almost everything that is in the tests. Overall Mr. Sichel is a great professor, take him!

Half the time, class is a snoozefest, half the time it's fascinating. His voice is kind of droning and relaxing, so it can be hard to stay awake. Not too hard, though; just do the reading when you can't pay attention and you're fine. Still recommend attending class, but usually reading will be enough.

Seriously one of the most boring classes I've ever taken. He literally lectures for an hour and 15 min straight. The 1st half of the semester has nothing to do with BUSINESS, which is what the class is supposed to be about. Tests (6 of them!) are easy if you go to class and take notes. He talks extremely fast though. Only take him if you have to.

I started out going to this class but stopped because I could never make it in time to get a good seat. I bought the study guide and took notes and I've gotten nothing but A's. Go or don't go but pay attention to definitions. The two pages of notes helps AMAZINGLY. This class is definitely a breeze.

Took class bc it was only one available. Never went, still got a B. Use the textbook if you dont go to class. Lets you have 2 pages of notes for each test. Test are tricky and all application problems. He does give extra credit for each test and at the end of the semester.  Very, very nice guy and lets you do makeups if you miss an exam.

This class is really easy.  He allows notes for tests and gives makeup tests after every test.  I have the soft cover text book required for this class.  I'm selling it $50 cheaper than the bookstore.  If interested email courtxxcourt@yahoo.com.

Good professor.  Allows notes on test, gives extra questions on the tests.  Lectures can be a bit boring and he doesn't like people not attending class even though he says it's not mandatory.  All in all a good professor, he really makes sure you understand if you come to class.

Easiest teacher ever. Allows 2 pages of anything for the test. I MADE OVER A 100 IN THIS CLASS and I still have my notes that I used on the tests. If you want to save yourself the trouble and make an A, you can buy mine for $25. 678-983-2486

EASY BLAW Teacher.  Allows 2 pages of notes for each test.  Takes notes in class and use those to make test sheet.  My lowest test grade was a 94 using this method.  You will easily get an "A" doing this.

He was a very helpful professor and he made sure to preach the relevance of all the material, made sure to not what would not be on the exams and would be more for just general knowledge. He lets you use 2 pages of notes for all exams (no limits on font or margin sizes) and gives extra problems so you can get over a 100. He also gives a curve.

AMAZING!!! It is so easy to get an A. He is very clear and talkes about it in terms that anyone can understand. you get off jewish holidays!!! 2 pages of notes for every test. Tests are pretty easy if you read or come to class...you don't need to do both unless you want to. I got a 104% in the class. I didn't know that was possible!!! Take Him!!!
Great teacher!!!!!!!!!!!! Allow 2 page cheat sheet in exams. Just read questions carefully during exam kind of tricky. If you miss exam he gives make-ups after every test.
Easy A if you come to class, listen to lecture and read the book.  He basically follows the book word for word, so you could probably skip and still make an easy C.
INTERESTING SPEAKER. GOOD CLASS. WILL GET AN A IF YOU LISTEN & TAKE GOOD NOTES.
An easy class if you read and take solid notes. Even if you know a good bit about law, he can teach you plenty.

Tests are a little hard at times because of his weird questions/scenarios but he lets you bring 2 pages of notes. Be sure to know the concepts and not just the def. He is very funny. FUN CLASS! He doesn't take attendance but it's better if you go although everything will come directly from the book.

Brings great real-life experience to the lectures, is very clear in his explanations and keeps the class laughing. Fun conversational debates in class. Tests mainly from the book. 2 pages of notes for tests are helpful, but you have to learn to apply the knowledge, not just regurgitate facts.

Good class. Learn a lot. You get two pages of notes for each test but beware the tests are still hard. Application of the knowledge is needed. Try to make it to class, read the book and type up some killer notes (in small font!) and you can hack out an A!
Professor Sichel is wonderful and engaging.  His lectures are clear and informative.  He is enthusiastic about what he teaches and enriches his lectures with real world experience.
